sting

Annotation Type Service


  • @Target(value={PARAMETER,METHOD})
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Documented
public @interface Service
    A service specification. The annotation can be used to declare a service that is consumed or published by a component and/or an injector.

    If the annotation is used to declare a service that a component consumes it can either annotate a constructor parameter for Injectable components or annotate a method parameter for Provides components. The default value for the type() element is the type of the parameter.

    The annotation can also be used to declare a service that is required by an injector and is expected to be made available to other components to consume within the injectors component graph. In this scenario, the service is added to the Injector.inputs() element. There is no default value for the type() element and the compiler will generate an error if it is not supplied.

    TODO: Implement, document and describe how to publish a service spec.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      NecessityType necessity
      A parameter indicating whether the service is required or optional.
      String qualifier
      An opaque string that qualifies the service.
      Class<?> type
      The java type of the service.

    • Element Detail

      • qualifier

        @Nonnull public abstract String qualifier
        An opaque string that qualifies the service. The string is user-supplied and used to distinguish two different services with the same type() but different semantics.
        Returns:
        an opaque qualifier string.
        Default:
        ""

      • type

        public abstract Class<?> type
        The java type of the service.

        The default value for this element is derived according to the heuristics documented at the class level. If the user specifies a type for this element then instances of the type MUST be assignable to the type that would be derived using the above mentioned heuristics.

        Sting does not support classes defined with type parameters.

        Returns:
        the java type of the service.
        Default:
        void.class

      • necessity

        @Nonnull public abstract NecessityType necessity
        A parameter indicating whether the service is required or optional.
        Returns:
        a parameter indicating whether the service is required or optional.
        Default:
        sting.NecessityType.AUTODETECT
